title: Art Deco sans on cover of old Swedish piano lesson booklet
content:
This type is taken from the cover of an old swedish piano lesson booklet.  
Does anyone know wich font (if any) this is? Fonts with similarities are also appreciated.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090702064544im_/http:/typophile.com/files/artdecosans_6347.jpg)
author: steinhhaugen

comments.content:
[http://www.linotype.com/153221/itcsilvermoonbold-font.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090702064544/http:/www.linotype.com/153221/itcsilvermoonbold-font.html "http://www.linotype.com/153221/itcsilvermoonbold-font.html")

That font has a similar feel... but I’ve had no luck with this one.

—  
Jean Ly  
Quantum Signs & Graphics
Most definitely hand lettered, and difficult to match.

A few more idiosyncratic stressed sans-serifs (though no match):  
 [Trio](http://web.archive.org/web/20090702064544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/trio-ct/), [Cameo](http://web.archive.org/web/20090702064544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/cameo-rr/).
